Description: Ostracon, large section of the upper-body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and contains many small white inclusions, the interior is covered with a grey-brown dried resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and faint traces of two lines of red-painted Coptic text, writ large.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394469) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394469)
